revised_title: Petrification in Human Bodies: A Case Study
tldr: This article narrates two cases of petrification in human bodies. The first case involves a woman with a history of sedentary lifestyle and kidney issues, who upon her death, was found to have her right kidney petrified. The second case is about a young man suffering from consumption, whose lungs were filled with gravel and small stones. These cases provide insights into the understanding of nephritis and kidney stones.
